name: Junxiao SONG
body:
### Journal Papers
1. Licheng Zhao, Junxiao Song, Prabu Babu, and Daniel P. Palomar, “A Unified Framework for Low Autocorrelation Sequence Design via Majorization-Minimization,” accepted in *IEEE Trans. on Signal Processing*, submitted May 2016.

2. Junxiao Song, Prabhu Babu, and Daniel P. Palomar, “Sequence Set Design With Good Correlation Properties Via Majorization-Minimization,” *IEEE Trans. on Signal Processing*, vol. 64, no. 11, pp. 2866-2879, June 2016.

3. Junxiao Song, Prabhu Babu, and Daniel P. Palomar, “Sequence Design to Minimize the Weighted Integrated and Peak Sidelobe Levels,” *IEEE Trans. on Signal Processing*, vol. 64, no. 8, pp. 2051-2064, April 2016.

4. Junxiao Song, Prabhu Babu, and Daniel P. Palomar, “Optimization Methods for Designing Sequences With Low Autocorrelation Sidelobes,” *IEEE Trans. on Signal Processing*, vol. 63, no. 15, pp. 3998-4009, Aug. 2015.

5. Junxiao Song, Prabhu Babu, and Daniel P. Palomar, “Sparse Generalized Eigenvalue Problem via Smooth Optimization,” *IEEE Trans. on Signal Processing*, vol. 63, no. 7, pp. 1627-1642, April 2015. [[Matlab code]](https://github.com/junxiaosong/junxiaosong.github.io/raw/master/code/sparse_GEVP_code.rar)

6. Xiaopeng Fan, Junxiao Song, Daniel P. Palomar, and Oscar C. Au, “Universal Binary Semidefinite Relaxation for ML Signal Detection,” *IEEE Trans. on Communications*, vol. 61, no. 11, pp. 4565-4576, Nov. 2013.

### Conference Papers
1. J. Song, P. Babu and D. P. Palomar, "Sequence design to minimize the peak sidelobe level," *2016 IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing (ICASSP)*, Shanghai, 2016, pp. 3896-3900.

2. J. Song, P. Babu and D. P. Palomar, "Optimization methods for sequence design with low autocorrelation sidelobes," *2015 IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing (ICASSP)*, South Brisbane, QLD, 2015, pp. 3033-3037.

3. J. Song, P. Babu and D. P. Palomar, "A fast algorithm for sparse generalized eigenvalue problem," *2014 48th Asilomar Conference on Signals, Systems and Computers*, Pacific Grove, CA, 2014, pp. 1652-1656.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
